name: Workday
title: AI Pivot Restructuring — 1,750 Layoffs (8.5%)

classification.classificationRationale: Tentative Model 6a. Workday is cutting 1,750 jobs (8.5% of workforce) with CEO Carl Eschenbach citing 'increasing demand for AI' as driver. Continued hiring in 'key strategic areas' (AI-targeted). No dedicated AI lab, CAIO, or CoE described — the restructuring is enterprise-wide reallocation framed as AI pivot. Low confidence: this may be cost-cutting framed as AI ('AI-washing'). Restructuring announcement rather than observed AI org structure.

description:
Workday announced 1,750 layoffs (8.5% of workforce) in February 2025, with CEO Carl Eschenbach explicitly citing AI as the driver: 'Companies everywhere are reimagining how work gets done, and the increasing demand for AI has the potential to drive a new era of growth for Workday.'

The company simultaneously announced continued hiring in 'key strategic areas' including AI, suggesting a workforce composition shift rather than pure headcount reduction. Restructuring charges of $230-270M for severance and benefits.

This specimen is primarily valuable as an 'AI-washing' data point. Only 4-5% of tech layoffs explicitly cite AI as driver, and critics note companies may be using AI narrative to justify cost reductions. Former Amazon employee quoted: 'You could potentially have just been bloated in the first place, reduce head count, attribute it to AI, and now you've got a value story.' The specimen parallels Pinterest (also explicit AI-pivot layoffs) but with even less structural evidence of actual AI organizational change.

openQuestions: Is this genuine AI restructuring or cost-cutting framed as AI?
What AI roles are being created with the 'key strategic areas' hiring?
How does Workday's own AI product (Illuminate) relate to internal AI org structure?
What is Workday's actual AI team size and structure?
taxonomyFeedback: Workday is primarily valuable as an AI-washing data point. The gap between 'AI as stated reason for restructuring' and 'AI as actual driver of organizational change' is widening across the tech sector.
Parallels Pinterest: both are mid-tier tech companies tying workforce cuts to AI pivot with minimal evidence of actual AI organizational structure change.
